intro: Tetramerista crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaf tetramerista, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the island's tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
